text: Philip Freelon (March 26, 1953 â€“ July 9, 2019), was an American architect. He was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Freelon was best known for leading the design team (with J. Max Bond, Jr. of Davis Brody Bond, and David Adjaye) of the Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of African American History and Culture. He was also known for his designs for National Center for Civil and Human Rights and Museum of the African Diaspora. Freelon died on July 9, 2019 at his home in Durham, North Carolina from problems caused by amyotrophic lateral sclerosis at the age of 67.Phil Freelon, Architect Who Helped Design Smithsonian's African-American Museum, Dies at 67 ==References== Category:1952 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from motor neurone disease Category:American architects Category:Educators from Philadelphia Category:Businesspeople from Philadelphia
